synopsis: In episode #10 featuring Rishabh Meswani, the hosts delve into the transformative power of debate and the journey of running a non-profit organization. They explore the challenges and rewards of leadership, the importance of communication, and the need for personal fulfillment in both work and life, while also sharing humorous anecdotes and insights about navigating youth culture.
quotes: The worst case scenario is not the end of the world; it's just a part of the journey.
Everyone should go try to figure out what's best for them, and that's really important.
You have to give yourself enough exposure to find something you're passionate about.
Sometimes, if work is really stressful, FDA is going to have to take the backseat.
It's important to find something and you're passionate about that you enjoy doing.
If you can identify the worst case, you can prepare your mind for it.
You can't stay in this gray state where it's just like, 'Oh, I have to do this, I hate this.'
Every company says they want you to grow, but it's not as easy as that.
Just because you care about something so much, doesn't mean someone else does.
I think optimism is really important; it keeps you happier when things go slightly better than the worst case.
